variants.Description in input context: M26I mutation reduces DJ-1 expression, particularly in a null background (knockout mouse embryonic fibroblasts). Thus, homozygous M26I mutation causes loss of DJ-1 protein.

C106A mutation of the central redox site specifically abolished binding to ASK1 and the cytoprotective activity of DJ-1. DJ-1 was apparently recruited into the ASK1 signalosome via Cys-106-linked mixed disulfides.
mutations of peripheral redox sites (C46A and C53A) and M26I also led to constitutive ASK1 binding.
mutations of peripheral redox sites (C46A and C53A) and M26I also led to constitutive ASK1 binding.
